info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 04 at 9:48AM MDT until June 09 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Glasgow affecting Valley County. For the Milk River...including Glasgow...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Glasgow. * WHEN...Until Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 26.8 feet, Back trail in Sullivan Park begins to flood. At 28.0 feet, Water begins to flow across 6th Ave SW also known as Aitken Road south of the Milk River Bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 27.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM MDT Sunday was 27.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 27.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will remain near or in minor flood stage through Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.7 feet on 03/20/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Milk River Glasgow 25.0 27.1 Sun 8 am MDT 26.4 24.5 26.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1000 PM MDT.
